title: Career Spotlight: Technologist (Ages 14-18)
summary: What does a technologist do? Technologists are professionals who research, develop, and test emerging technologies. They also find useful ways to put new technologies to work. A technologist is an expert in a specific type of technology, often within a specific field. Many industries rely on innovations developed by technologists. Some of these include aerospace, […]

title: Career Spotlight: Scientist (Ages  14-18)
summary: What does a scientist do? Science is about exploring answers to questions. A scientist uses research and evidence to form hypotheses, test variables, and then share their findings. NASA scientists conduct groundbreaking research to answer some of humanity’s most profound questions. Most scientists start as project scientists in their early careers. They spend a lot […]

title: 20-Year Hubble Study of Uranus Yields New Atmospheric Insights
summary: The ice-giant planet Uranus, which travels around the Sun tipped on its side, is a weird and mysterious world. Now, in an unprecedented study spanning two decades, researchers using NASA’s Hubble Space Telescope have uncovered new insights into the planet’s atmospheric composition and dynamics. This was possible only because of Hubble’s sharp resolution, spectral capabilities, […]

title: University High Triumphs at JPL-Hosted Ocean Sciences Bowl
summary: The annual regional event puts students’ knowledge of ocean-related science to the test in a fast-paced academic competition. title: El X-59 de la NASA completa la prueba de ‘control de crucero’ mantenimiento automático de velocidad del motor
summary: Read this story in English here.
